intro: Glyphotaenium integrum, commonly known as the smoothleaf glyphotaenium, is a perennial herb native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a fine, silky hair. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in poor, sandy soils. Due to its drought tolerance, it is often used in xeriscaping and as a ground cover in dry landscapes.
